1.name: strong typing
1.description: specificity of a programming language's syntax when manipulating types of data

2.name: weak typing
2.description: the opposite of strong typing discipline

4.name: nominative typing
4.description: major class of type system, in which compatibility and equivalence of data types is determined by explicit declarations and/or the name of the types

6.name: inference typing
6.description: automatic detection of the data type of an expression in a programming language

7.name: polymorphism
7.description: in programming languages and type theory, accessing different types using a common interface

8.name: partial inference typing
8.description: a style of dynamic typing in object-oriented programming

10.name: dynamic typing
10.description: a style of dynamic typing in object oriented programming

11.name: static typing
11.description: type system paradigm where all type checking is done at compile time

12.name: structural type system
12.description: major class of type system, in which type compatibility and equivalence are determined by the type's actual structure or definition, and not by other characteristics such as its name or place of declaration

13.name: duck typing
13.description: a style of dynamic typing in object oriented programming
